summary.para: This UserControl allows the user to access the key PTE maintenance and administrative operations via a set of Button controls on the 'Control Panel' and gives feedback, via the 'PTE STATUS' panel, on its current operational status.

The UserControl monitors: TextChanged; EnabledChanged; CheckedChanged; MdiChildActive; MenuUpdated; and ChangeFont PTE events and uses the PerformClick() method associated with the ToolStripMeneuItem control to modify the standard PTE User Interface to that specified in the NYCT specification.

member.name: T:Bombardier.PTU.Communication.CommunicationApplication
member.summary: Class to manage communication with the target hardare with respect to the main PTU application.

summary.para: The boundary year value for 2 digit year codes.

If the 2 digit year code returned from the VCU is within the supported range (00 to 99) and is above or equal to the value of YearBoundary then the 4 digit year code is deemed to be associated with the 20th Century.
If the year code is below YearBoundary then the 2 digit year code is associated with the 21st Century. This ensures that the PTU displays the correct date between 1970 - 2069. Value: 70.

member.name: F:Bombardier.PTU.Communication.CommunicationApplication.Century20th
member.summary: The value to be added to the 2 digit year code if the year is associated with the 20th Century. Value: 1900.

member.name: F:Bombardier.PTU.Communication.CommunicationApplication.Century21st
member.summary: The value to be added to the 2 digit year code if the year is associated with the 21st Century. Value: 2000.

member.name: F:Bombardier.PTU.Communication.CommunicationApplication.YearCode2DigitMax
member.summary: The maximum supported value for 2 digit year codes. Value: 99.

member.name: F:Bombardier.PTU.Communication.CommunicationApplication.YearCode2DigitMin
member.summary: The minimum supported value for 2 digit year codes. Value: 0.

member.name: F:Bombardier.PTU.Communication.CommunicationApplication.YearCode4DigitMax
member.summary: The maximum supported 4 digit year code on a 2 digit year code VCU. Value: 2069.

member.name: F:Bombardier.PTU.Communication.CommunicationApplication.YearCode4DigitMin
member.summary: The minimum supported 4 digit year code on a 2 digit year code VCU. Value: 1970.

summary.para: The value to represent that the SetTimeDate() and GetTimeDate() use4DigitYearCode flag parameter is True.
This parameter specifies whether the Vehicle Control Unit uses a 2 or 4 digit year code. True, if it uses a 4 digit year code; otherwise, false. Value: 0x01.
The value to represent that the SetTimeDate() and GetTimeDate() use4DigitYearCode flag parameter is False.
This parameter\ specifies whether the Vehicle Control Unit uses a 2 or 4 digit year code. True, if it uses a 4 digit year code; otherwise, false. Value: 0x00.

member.name: M:Bombardier.PTU.Communication.CommunicationApplication.ScanPort(Common.Communication.CommunicationSetting_t,Common.Communication.TargetConfiguration_t@)
member.summary: Scan the specified serial communication port to determine if it is connected to a target logic controller. If a target is found the target configuration information is written to the output parameter .
member.param: The communication settings that are to be used to communicate with the target.
The target configuration information returned from the target hardware if a target is found.
member.returns: A flag to indicate whether a target was found; true, if a target was found, otherwise, false.
member.exception: Thrown if the error code returned from the call to the PTUDLL32.InitCommunication() method is not CommunicationError.Success.

member.name: M:Bombardier.PTU.Communication.CommunicationApplication.ConvertYearTo4DigitFormat(System.Int16)

summary.para: Convert a 2 digit year code that is within the supported range to its equivalent 4 digit year code.

Any 2 digit year code that is within the supported range, 00 to 99, and is >= 70 is converted to (1900 + 2 digit year code) and any value that is less than 70 is converted to (2000 + 2 digit year code) e.g. 00 --> 2000, 69 --> 2069, 70 --> 1970, 99 --> 1999.
Any 2 digit year code that is > 99 returns a value of 2069 and any value less than 0 returns a value of 1970.

member.param: A 2 digit year code that is within the supported range. Valid 2 digit year codes are in the range 00 to 99.
member.returns: The 4 digit year code corresponding to the specified 2 digit year code e.g. 00 --> 2000, 69 --> 2069, 70 --> 1970, 99 --> 1999 etc.

member.name: M:Bombardier.PTU.Communication.CommunicationApplication.ConvertYearTo2DigitFormat(System.Int16)

summary.para: Convert a 4 digit year code that is within the supported range to its equivalent 2 digit year code.

Any 4 digit year code that is within the supported range, 1970 to 2069, but less than 2000 is converted to (4 digit year code - 1900) and any value that is >= 2000 is converted to (4 digit year code - 2000) e.g. 1970 --> 70, 1999 --> 99, 2000 --> 00, 2069 --> 69.
Any 4 digit year code that is outside the supported range is converted to YearBoundary i.e. 70.

member.param: A 4 digit year code that is within the supported range. Supported 4 digit year codes are in the range 1970 to 2069.
member.returns: The 2 digit year code corresponding to the specified 4 digit year code e.g. 1970 --> 70, 1999 --> 99, 2000 --> 00, 2069 --> 69.

member.summary: Main user interface for the Portable Test Unit (PTU) application.
Methods to support the MdiPTU class.

member.name: F:Bombardier.PTU.MdiPTU.IntervalMsWibuBoxUpdate
member.summary: Th interval, in ms, between successive checks to see whether the WibuBox is still attached to the system. Value: 5,000.

member.name: F:Bombardier.PTU.MdiPTU.CarNumberMax
member.summary: The Maximum car number value associated with any project. This is derived from the car identifier string that is downloaded from the VCU/COMC unit. On most projects this is a string representation of a numeric value, however, on the BART project this numeric value is prepended with either 'D' or 'E' depending upon the car type. Despite being prepended with either 'D' or 'E' the numeric value is still unique, therefore the car number on BART is derived by simply stripping off the car type character. Value: 9999.

member.name: F:Bombardier.PTU.MdiPTU.VERSION_LENGTH
member.summary: The number of characters which are snipped off of the tail end of the version string to generate the default filenames for the help and database files. Methodology is a legacy of the DDB tool.

Also update the ProjectIdentifierPassedAsParameter property with string value of the specified project identifier regardless of whether the corresponding XML configuration file exists or not.

member.name: M:Bombardier.PTU.MdiPTU.WriteCarIdentifier(System.String)
member.summary: Write the specified car identifier string in the status label used to display the car identifier, convert the car identifier string to a numeric value and update the CarNumber property.
member.remarks: The car identifier string on BART includes a leading 'D' or 'E' car type identifier, it is necessary to remove this before attempting to convert the car identifier string to a numeric value, otherwise an exception is thrown.
member.param: The car identifier string. Valid values are from "0000" to "9999". All 4 digits must be specified.

member.name: M:Bombardier.PTU.MdiPTU.LoadDictionary(Common.Configuration.DataDictionary)

summary.para: Configures the PTU application using the specified data dictionary. The configuration procedure is as follows:
(1) updates the Parameter class;
(2) updates the Lookup static class to allow the records contained within the primary key data tables of the data dictionary to be accessed;
(3) creates the application data sub-directories if they do not exist;
(4) updates the main menu options to reflect the current project and security level;
(5) updates the file header information;
(6) loads the default worksets associated with the specified data dictionary, if they exist;
(7) loads the help file associated with the current project and software version;
(8) shows the 'Help/About' screen.

member.param: The data dictionary that is to be used to configure the PTU.

member.name: M:Bombardier.PTU.MdiPTU.SetMode(Common.Mode)
member.summary: Set the current mode of operation. This will set the on-line/off-line buttons; status line text and menu options to reflect the specified mode.
member.param: The new mode of operation.

member.name: M:Bombardier.PTU.MdiPTU.LoadWorksetCollection(Common.Configuration.WorksetCollection,System.String)
member.summary: Load the specified workset collection file from disk and then set the active workset to be the default workset. If the workset collection file does not exist or is corrupt, then an empty workset collection file is created.
member.remarks: The workset collection filename is derived as follows: {project identifier}.{workset collection type}.{extension} and it is assumed that it is located in the 'DirectoryManager.PathwWorksetFiles' directory.
member.param: The workset collection that is to be loaded from disk.
The project identifier used to generate the workset filename.

member.name: M:Bombardier.PTU.MdiPTU.InitializePTUProjectSpecific(System.String)

summary.para: Initialize the project specific features of the PTU application:
(1) check whether a WibuBox is required for the project and, if so, initialize it;
(2) check whether the project uses a control panel and, if so, initialize it.

member.param: The project identifier string that was passed as a shortcut parameter.

summary.para: Initialize the PTU application:
(1) position the form;
(2) update the LogStatus StatusLabel, regardless of whether this is visible for the current project;
(3) set the font;
(4) instantiate the menu interfaces to the various sub-systems;
(5) create the required PTU configuration sub-directories if they don't already exist;
(6) initialize the menu system;
(7) set the 'Checked' property of the 'Configure/Enumeration' menu option; and
(8) clear the Restart property to ensure that the program terminates when the Close() method is called.

member.name: M:Bombardier.PTU.MdiPTU.LoadAllWorksetCollections(System.String)
member.summary: Load all workset collections associated with the specified project identifier from disk. The filename of the file containing the workset collection is derived from the project identifier as follows: {project identifier}.{workset collection type}.{extension}.
member.param: The project identifier associated with the data dictionary.

member.name: M:Bombardier.PTU.MdiPTU.LoadHelpFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Load the help file associated with the specified project version reference.
member.remarks: The help filename is derived as follows: '{project version reference}.hlp' and it is assumed that it is located in the 'DirectoryManager.' directory.
member.param: The project version reference, used to generate the filename of the help file.
The project identifier code

member.name: M:Bombardier.PTU.MdiPTU.InitializeDataSubDirectories
member.summary: Determines the configured PTU application data directory path and: (a) creates the PTU application data directory, if it does not exist; (b) creates the PTU application data sub-directories, if they do not exist and (c) resets the initial directory paths associated with reading and writing data from/to the PTU application data directories to their default values.
member.remarks: Uses the static classes Parameter and DirectoryManager.
